block.p: A consultant was sentenced on Wednesday to six months of house detention after pleading guilty to interstate transportation of technical documents stolen from the General Electric Company.
United States District Judge David S. Nelson also fined Chien-Min Sung $200,000 and ordered him to make restitution of $120,000 to G.E.

Mr. Sung, 43 years old, admitted he had failed to return about 80 documents containing technical information owned by G.E. when he left the company in 1987 to take a job with the Norton Company in Worcester, Mass. He is now a private consultant.
